column4: FirstStrike: I personally don't like Gnome because it reminds me of a confused user.
yeah- perhaps- but I've installed gnome for a few kids with really old systems and they couldn't be happier with the gloss and the glitter. :D
I'm not having a go at anyone in particular... Gnome doesn't float my boat, but I'm sure plenty of other folks are perfectly happy.
today I'm on my third day with my first ever mac... believe me, at this point in time I'd be more comfortable with winders!!!
yeah. no worries- am not a DE-fanatic and gnome-foot-logo flag waving jingoist.
(I already set it up to triple boot osx, winders and kubuntu, mostly just to prove it could be done!)
;P i've heard 'em call winbl0ws or something most of the time
I think that "winders" is appropriately polite, and appropriately disrespectful at the same time! :-)
so how does OS X compare to linux- i know- not the same material. But i'm really tired of apple-junkies trying to convince me that I'll never go back to any other OS if I tried it.
the jury is still out here. It's only been about three days for me so far, and it's tough going.
I won't be truly happy until I can survive without a mouse... the lack of knowledge of keyboard shortcuts is driving me nuts so far!

I think that gnome or kde (ubuntu/kubuntu) are a lot more windows-like than mac. mac, so far, seems to be out there on its own with a whole bunch of new windowing-environment stuff that doesn't correspond to the rest
Yeah, reminds me of this bit in the TrueX mouse website about how windows users have stronger index fingers with all the mouse-clicking
I can get around winders quite happily with no mouse... that's what's bugging me here on osx.... can't manage wihtout a mouse
